text.tspan: Solids have thick energy levels, called bands,
that can absorb a wide range of frequencies
Thus, a current flows whenever light shines on
After absorbing a light photon, the positively
charged spot left behind is called a hole
If the excited electron is absorbed near the
electric field, the electron will separate from
A semiconductor can absorb a large chunk of
the solar spectrum without losing too much
energy as heat from overly excited electrons
The excited electron will randomly decay back
into the hole and lose this excited energy
This creates a very short electric field from
electrons and holes cancelling each other at
In order to extract this excited energy, the
